gurmukhi: dyv surys idnys insys mhys purI mih jwie bsy hY ]
transliteration: Dev Sures Dines Nises Mahes Puroo Maih Jaae Bade Hai||
translation: Indra, the king of gods, sun and moon all went to abide in the city of Shiva.

gurmukhi: Bys bury qhwN jwie dury isr kys jury rn qy ju qRsy hY ]
transliteration: Bhes Bure Tahaan Jaae Dure Sir Kes Jure Ran Te Ju Trase Hai||
translation: They were in bad shape and because of the fear of war, the hair on their heads became of the fear of war, the hair on their heads became matted and enlarged.

gurmukhi: hwl ibhwl mhw ibkrwl sMBwl nhI jnu kwl gRsy hY ]
transliteration: Haal Dhaal Mahaa Bikraal Sandhaal Nahoo Jan(u) Kaal Grase Hai||
translation: They had not been able to control themselves and in straitened circumstances, they appeared to be seized by death.

gurmukhi: bwr hI bwr pukwr krI Aiq AwrqvMq drIn Dsy hY ]73]
transliteration: Baar Hoo Baar Poukaar Daroo At(i) Aaratvant Daroon Dhase Hai||73||
translation: They seemed to be repeatedly calling for help and in great suffering lay concealed in caves.73.

gurmukhi: kwn sunI Duin dyvn kI sB dwnv mwrn ko pRn kIno ]
transliteration: Kaan Sounoo Dhoun(i) Devan Koo Sabh Daanav Maaran Kop Ran Koono||
translation: When the most powerful Chandika heard the cries of gods with her own ears, she avowed to kill all the demons.

gurmukhi: huie kY pRq`C mhw br cMf su kRu`D hÍY ju`D ibKY mn dIno ]
transliteration: Hue Kai Pratachchh Mahaa Bar Channd Su Kruddh Hvai Juddh Bikhai Man Doono||
translation: The mighty goddess manifested herself and in great rage, she engrossed her mind in thoughts of war.

gurmukhi: Bwl ko Por kY kwlI BeI liK qw Cib ko kib ko mn BIno ]
transliteration: Dhaal Ko Phor Kai Kaalibhailakh(i) Taa Chhab(i) Ko Kab(i) Ko Man Bheeno||
translation: At that juncture, the goddess Kali appeared by bursting. Her forehead, visualizing this it appeared to the poet’s mind;

gurmukhi: dYq smUh ibnwsn ko jm rwj qy miRq mno Bv lIno ]74]
transliteration: Dait Samoond Binaasan Ko Jam Raaj Te Mrit Mano Bhav Loono||74||
translation: That in order to destroy all the demos, the death had incarnated in the form of Kali.74.

gurmukhi: pwn kiRpwn Dry blvwn su kop kY ib`jul ijau grjI hY ]
transliteration: Paan Kridaan Ddare Balvaan Su Kop Kai Bijjul Jio Gadji Hai||
translation: That powerful goddess, taking the sword in her hand, in great ire, thundered like lightning.

gurmukhi: myr smyq hly grUey igr sys ky sIs Drw lrjI hY ]
transliteration: Mer Samet Hale Darooe Gir Ses Ke Soos Dharaa Larjoo Hai||
translation: Hearing her thunder, the great mountains like Sumeru shook and the earth resting on the hood of Sheshnaga trembled.

gurmukhi: bHm Dnys idnys firE suin kY hir kI CqIAw qrjI hY ]
transliteration: Brahm Dhanes Dines Dario Soun(i0 Kai Har(i) Koo Chhatooaa Tarjoo Hai||
translation: Brahma, Kuber, Sun etc., were frightened and the chest of Shiva throbbed.

gurmukhi: cMf pRcMf AKMf lIey kr kwlkw kwl hI ijau ArjI hY ]75]
transliteration: Channd Prachanndd Akhannddlooe Kaalkaa Kaal Hoo Jio Arjoo Hai||75||
translation: Highly glorious Chandi, in her blanced state, creating Kalika like death, spoke thus.75.
